title: 113_s1268
content: APPROVAL OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. The curr_chunk defines "Agreement" and "Compact of Free Association" and discusses the results of the Compact Review. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 are approved, with the exception of the extension of article X regarding Federal Programs and Services. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010, are approved, excluding the extension of article X on Federal Programs and Services. If the Republic of Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013, funds under specific sections will be withheld. If Palau withdraws more than $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013, certain funds will be withheld until the amount is reimbursed. In fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013, funds will be withheld from Palau until they reimburse the trust fund for any amounts withdrawn over $5,000,000. Additionally, the Secretary of the Treasury will transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing specific provisions of the Compact of Free Association. Within 30 days of enactment, the Secretary of the Treasury will transfer funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing sections of the Agreement. Authorization of appropriations is provided for subsidizing postal services to certain countries. Authorization of appropriations is provided for subsidizing postal services to the Republic of Palau, the Republic of the Marshall Islands, and the Federated States of Micronesia, with $1,500,000 allocated for each fiscal year from 2014 to 2024. The funds will remain available until expended without further appropriation. The Federated States of Micronesia will receive $1,500,000 annually from 2014 to 2024 for postal services, with funds remaining available until expended. Additionally, funding will be provided to Federal entities to carry out their responsibilities under the Compact of Free Association. The Federal entities will receive necessary funds to fulfill their responsibilities under the Compact of Free Association. Additionally, a section of the Act of June 30, 1954 is repealed. The Agreement's payment schedule and funding will be adjusted accordingly. The Compact Section 211(f) fund is established, providing necessary funds for Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association. The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund established under the Compact of Free Association. This contribution will be made in installments over several fiscal years according to a specified schedule. Additionally, the Government will provide a grant for infrastructure maintenance. The Government of the United States will provide grants totaling $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 for an Infrastructure Maintenance Fund to support maintenance of capital improvement projects. The Government of the Republic of Palau will match the United States' contributions to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund with $150,000 quarterly from 2014 to 2024. The implementation will follow the provisions of the Agreement. The Republic of Palau will match the United States' contributions by providing $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024, following the Agreement's provisions. The Republic of Palau will match the United States' contributions by providing $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024, following the Agreement's provisions. SEC. 3. FISCAL CONSOLIDATION FUND. The United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears, in addition to previous economic assistance. The implementation will follow specific provisions outlined in the Agreement. The United States will provide Palau with $69,250,000 in economic assistance over the next few years, with specific amounts allocated for each fiscal year starting from 2014. The United States will provide Palau with $69,250,000 in economic assistance over the next few years, with specific amounts allocated for each fiscal year from 2014 to 2023. The United States will provide Palau with economic assistance totaling $69,250,000 over the years 2014 to 2023, with specific amounts allocated for each fiscal year. The funds for economic assistance in each fiscal year will be provided in 4 quarterly payments unless otherwise specified. The funds for economic assistance in each fiscal year will be provided in 4 quarterly payments (30% in the first quarter, 30% in the second quarter, 20% in the third quarter, and 20% in the fourth quarter) unless specified otherwise. "SEC. 5. INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS." The United States will provide grants totaling $40,000,000 to Palau for infrastructure projects. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 is amended to extend programs until 2024. Passport requirements under the Compact of Free Association are clarified. Passport requirements under the Compact of Free Association are clarified. Passport requirements for nonimmigrant admission to the US under the Compact of Free Association are specified, allowing certain individuals to enter and reside without certain restrictions of the Immigration and Nationality Act. Under the Compact of Free Association, specific passport requirements allow certain individuals to enter the US as nonimmigrants without certain Immigration and Nationality Act restrictions. This includes citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands who became citizens of Palau, those who acquire Palau citizenship at birth, and naturalized Palau citizens. Under the Compact of Free Association, individuals who are citizens of Palau under specific conditions are permitted to work in the United States with the approval of the Secretary of Homeland Security. This includes those who became citizens of Palau under the Trust Territory Code, those who acquire Palau citizenship at birth, and naturalized Palau citizens who have been residents for at least five years. Under the Compact of Free Association, Palau citizens who have been residents for at least five years after naturalization can work in the United States with permission from the Secretary of Homeland Security. They may establish habitual residence in a U.S. territory or possession, subject to non-discriminatory limitations in U.S. or territory regulations. A territory or possession of the United States may be subjected to non-discriminatory limitations in statutes or regulations of the United States or the territory itself, authorized by U.S. laws. Section 141(a) does not grant a citizen of Palau the right to establish residence for naturalization under the Immigration and Nationality Act or petition for benefits for alien relatives under that Act, but it does not prevent them from acquiring such rights through other means. Section 141(a) of the United States does not give a citizen of Palau the right to establish residence for naturalization under the Immigration and Nationality Act or petition for benefits for alien relatives under that Act. However, it does not prevent them from obtaining such rights through other methods.
